historySnippet.reasoning: Agency is already maxed (A=1.0) but drifting down with dA/dt<0 while C is decaying, so we keep U at the proven best (0.10) and counter the slide by slightly reducing k_C_decay and k_A_decay to stabilize C and sustain A without harming high D (history shows lowering k_C_decay previously improved A).

Agency is already maxed but dD/dt is strongly negative, so I’ll run a short “diversity rebuild” phase by dropping U while also reducing k_D_decay to arrest the collapse (history shows k_D_decay tweaks can help without harming A much).

Agency is already safely >0.75 and near the best record; since the best A=1.0 occurred at U=0.10 and recent tweaks to k_D_decay/k_A_decay have been noisy (sometimes hurting A), I’ll revert toward the best-challenge U while keeping current stabilizing params to avoid destabilizing C/D.

Agency is already safely >0.75 and still rising, but Diversity is starting to collapse (dD/dt=-0.0102), so I’ll keep U at the best-record value while reducing diversity decay pressure (lower k_D_decay) and slightly boosting intrinsic diversity regeneration (raise k_D_growth) to prevent a future diversity crash that could later undermine C and A.

Agency is already safely above 0.75 and slightly rising while Complexity is slowly decaying, so I’ll keep U at the best-record level (0.10) and make a small stabilizing tweak by reducing complexity decay (noting past k_C_decay reductions improved A) to prevent C erosion from eventually dragging A down.

Agency is already well above the 0.75 objective and trending upward, and since the best record was achieved at U=0.10 with essentially these params (history shows several k_D_decay tweaks caused volatility), I’ll keep U at the proven setting and make only a minimal sustaining tweak by lowering k_A_decay slightly to lock in high A without disturbing C/D dynamics.

Agency is already safely >0.75 and still rising, but Diversity is starting to collapse (dD/dt=-0.0052), so I’ll slightly reduce selection pressure via U to stabilize D while keeping parameters near the best-record regime (U≈0.10, k_DU low).

A is already safely >0.75 and still rising (dA/dt>0) while C is slightly decaying, so I’ll move U back toward the best-record 0.10 to add challenge/stimulation and offset C’s decay without increasing diversity pressure (keeping k_DU low as in the best params).

A is already at 1.0 but drifting down (dA/dt=-0.0008), so I’ll keep U at the proven best (0.10) and counter the fade with a small, low-risk reduction in k_A_decay to stabilize agency without disrupting the high C/D regime (history shows k_A_decay tweaks helped slightly at Gen 1717.7).

A is already safely above 0.75 but is slightly fading while C is decaying; since best A occurred at U=0.10 and recent tweaks around k_C_decay/k_A_decay showed minimal gains, keep U at the best-setting and reduce complexity/agency decay slightly to stabilize without hurting D (which is very high).

name: Low-U Entropy Helmsman
description: This agent crossed the Agency Threshold by tightly coupling agency to environmental difficulty (k_AU=0.99) while keeping agency decay extremely low (k_A_decay=0.0005), allowing it to retain gains even after multiple destabilizing parameter edits. It initially stumbled when U was set to 0.10 and when diversity/complexity decay terms were perturbed, but a later rebound came from rebalancing diversity dynamics (k_D_growth=0.5 with k_D_decay=0.003) and tuning environmental responsiveness (k_U=0.38), yielding a high-agency, high-complexity, high-diversity phenotype (A=0.992, C=0.952, D=0.991) that is resilient under mild difficulty.
